export const viewer = (node, {React}) => { const c = React.createElement const el = c('iframe', {srcDoc: `
`}) return el }
The above viewer breaks the document render, destroying the page, but therefore use of it is not persisted. Consider adding

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Test page</title>
  </head>
  <body>
  <script type="module">

    async function getViewer(src) {
      const module = await import(`data:text/javascript;base64,${ btoa(src)}`);
      return module.viewer;
    }

    getViewer(`export const viewer = () => "foo!"`).then(viewer => {
       alert("Got viewer " + !!viewer)
    })

  </script>
  </body>
</html>
